RelatedSentence: One of the common reasons for this to happen is the tendency of investors to look at the big winners of the previous bull market and to assume that they will re-emerge as winners in the next bull run .

In the bust that follows boom , the leaders of the previous bull run , after an exaggerated rally , typically see a very sharp correction in stock prices .

Hence it is quite natural that in the early stages of the next market run up , owing to reasons attributable to pure mean reversion , some of these stocks see a sharp bounce from their low price levels .
